title: [AUTH] Google AI OAuth integration
description: Phase 3: Google OAuth endpoints, GoogleAi provider variant, ion login google command

logs.msg:
OAuth infrastructure complete. GoogleAi provider integrated with:
- Google OAuth flow (PKCE)
- Token storage in ~/.config/ion/auth.json
- TUI provider picker shows GoogleAi
- Model fetching maps to Google models
Needs real-world testing with actual Google AI subscription.
Renamed from GoogleAi to Gemini. CLI: ion login gemini. Uses Gemini CLI client ID.

OAuth issue: Google API returns 'API key not valid' because llm-connector's GoogleProvider uses x-goog-api-key header, but OAuth tokens need Authorization: Bearer header. Need to either: (1) create custom HTTP client for OAuth, (2) contribute Bearer auth to llm-connector, or (3) use ConfigurableProtocol with custom auth.

Gemini OAuth login works but API calls fail. Consumer API (generativelanguage) only supports API keys. Code Assist API (cloudcode-pa) returns 403 Permission Denied with Gemini CLI client ID. May need Antigravity client ID or different scopes. Files: src/provider/gemini_oauth.rs, src/auth/google.rs

Gemini OAuth login succeeds but API calls to Code Assist API return 403 Permission Denied. Tried: consumer API (no OAuth support), Code Assist v1internal format, model name mapping. May need different client ID or scopes
